data.text: JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
The deposition in the above matter was held in room 4480, O'Neill House Office
Representatives Luria, Aguilar, Schiff, Lofgren, Murphy, and Kinzinger.
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
SENIOR INVESTIGATIVE COUNSEL AND OF COUNSEL TO THE VICE CHAIR
This is the deposition of Jeffrey Bossert Clark,
conducted by the House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack on the
United States Capitol, pursuant to House Resolution 503.
Mr. Clark, could you please state your full name and spell your name for the
Full name is Jeffrey Bossert Clark, last name spelled C-1-a-r-k.
This will be a staff-led deposition, and Members of the House, of
course, may choose to also ask questions.
I am a senior investigative counsel for the committee
and also of counsel to the vice chair, Representative Liz Cheney.
a professional staff member, and by video,
right now, we have Representative Lofgren and Representative Schiff.
other members may join us during the course of the deposition.
see when they do and announce their presence, but we can't always be certain we'll
Could counsel please state their names for the record.
transcript is the official record of the proceeding.
I am Harry MacDougald, for Mr. Clark.
Charley Burnham, on behalf of Mr. Clark.
As you can see, there is an official reporter transcribing the record of
The deposition is also being videotaped, but the court reporter's
Mr. Clark, as you know, please wait until each question is completed before you
begin your response, and we'll try to wait until your response is complete before we ask
our question, to make it easier for the court reporter.
As you know, the stenographer cannot record nonverbal responses, such as
shaking your head, so it's important that you answer each question with an audible verbal
We ask that you provide complete answers, based on your best recollection.
the question is not clear, please ask me to clarify it or repeat it.
answer, obviously, you can say so.

Do you solemnly declare and affirm under the penalty of perjury
that the testimony you are about to give will be the truth, the whole truth, and nothing
Mr. MacDougald, did you want to make a statement before we begin
It is not enough in Washington to merely disagree with someone about policy
his destruction by any means available.
Those who disagree with Mr. Clark seek

assume, unfortunately, that members of this committee and even its staff have been also

voicemail inviting him to the Pine Barrens in New Jersey to meet with him so that he

guy that left the voicemail for Mr. Clark.
My point is that this whole process has gone
Before we begin, I want to quickly summarize some of our legal arguments about
this committee and about this deposition.
composition and in its deeds for three fundamental reasons:
The committee is legally defective in its
First, the composition and membership are not in compliance with its enabling
Therefore, it cannot properly do business of any kind.
Now, I realize that so far that argument has been rejected in court on the theory that
your rules mean whatever you or the Speaker says they mean.
If the rules mean whatever you say they mean on any
given day, a Red Queen come to life, then there are no rules, and it's purely arbitrary and
gotten so far on that topic are unlikely to be the last word.
Either way, the committee is proceeding unlawfully.
Second, the committee has no properly constituted or designated ranking
enabling resolution or the House rules for the use of deposition authority, and no one can
be convicted of contempt for refusing to testify in deposition.
Therefore, it cannot use deposition authority under either its own
Third, counsel for the holder of the executive privileges and attorney-client

That is another unlawful element among many in how the committee is
That topic is covered in the letter I've given you today.

In its Trump derangement, the committee has abused its authority to a greater

with criminal prosecution on a completely spurious legal foundation.
unacceptable even if it were a proper exercise of legislative authority, which it is not.

aspect of January 6th, and nobody claims that he did.

It's a mighty peculiar approach to saving our democracy.

Other Members of the House and Senate and the committee's political allies are

written and published supposed road maps for criminal investigation and prosecution that

refer him for prosecution for political contempt -- for criminal contempt.
And, of course, the committee has already voted to
So it's not that we're paranoid or that our concerns are trifling or insubstantial.
The committee and its allies really are out to get Mr. Clark.
and well-founded concern that the committee's efforts and those of its political allies to
string up Mr. Clark will continue.
A serious and real concern is present, not because he did anything wrong, but
because there is a moral panic and a lynch mob coming after him, and the committee is
right out in front of that mob, egging them on.
We are not required to explain in this setting the exact chain of reasoning by

we instruct or advise Mr. Clark in this second deposition.
We explicitly reserve all other objections to the defective
